column2: b'Touching & productive conversation w/ Florida student survivors of gun violence. We\xe2\x80\x99re listening. And agree we need ACTION to stop this epidemic! I stand with our young leaders in support of sensible gun laws. \n#NeverAgain https://t.co/gCiOtA6qeF'

\xe2\x80\xa2Family planning
We must #ProtectTitleX! https://t.co/AX0Q7l8Ikc'

b'@DanDaley You make us proud to Vice Mayor!'

b'In bipartisan Fla Delegation Meeting where we are united in our opposition to offshore oil drilling around our state! #sayfie https://t.co/VYkl26XLXU'

b"It\xe2\x80\x99s #TimeToBuild. Americans deserve modern, fast, and reliable infrastructure. That's why I introduced the TUFGRID Act, to make our nation\xe2\x80\x99s electric infrastructure more resilient, especially for disaster-prone states like FL!  #InfrastructureWeek"

b'Today, Senate Dems vote to #SaveTheInternet. Proud to support similar #NetNeutrality legislation here in the House to protect small businesses & innovators in our district. The fight for a free and open internet continues! #Sayfie'

b"Today, I met with the Nevada Radiological Society to discuss ways to improve our health care system. I'm committed to fighting for Nevadans\xe2\x80\x99 access to quality, affordable health care. https://t.co/OPW5sO5t65"

b'On #IDAHOT, I stand with with our LGBTQ friends and neighbors in denouncing hate and bigotry and promoting love, acceptance, and full equality.'

b'This is a legacy to be proud of and one that we should build upon. We need to be working to make it easier\xe2\x80\x94not harder\xe2\x80\x94for workers to join unions\xe2\x80\x94to collectively bargain for fair wages, safe working conditions and health care.'

b'The Janus case is a nothing more than a political attack underwritten by corporations that will further rig our economy against workers. \n\nUnions have fought to win worker safety protections, sick leave, the 40 hour workweek and weekends\xe2\x80\x94throughout our country\xe2\x80\x99s history.'

b'In 1973, workers, on average, earned $16.74 per hour, adjusted for inflation. Since then, our economy has doubled. We can assume that workers\xe2\x80\x99
salaries have kept, right? 

Wrong. Workers now make just $17.86 per hour\xe2\x80\x94which is nowhere near enough to keep pace rising living costs.'
b'Union members are our country\xe2\x80\x99s teachers, ironworkers, nurses, government workers, bricklayers firefighters and machinists. They are the backbone of our communities.'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99m proud to come from a strong labor family, where my husband Steve\xe2\x80\x94who began his career as a union bricklayer and marble mason\xe2\x80\x94ended up leading the AFL-CIO King County Central Labor Council. We understand how important it is for workers to be able to unionize.'

b'Soon, the Supreme Court will rule on Janus v. AFSCME Council 31, a case that has the potential to hurt our workers, our communities and our economy. What Janus is looking at is whether or not American workers have the freedom and the right to collectively bargain.'

b'That the White House kept him in his position and granted him a permanent security clearance makes it clear that Congress needs to step in and create new safeguards for this process, which it should do by passing legislation I put forward: the Security Clearance Review Act. 6/6'

b'Jared Kushner does not deserve a permanent security clearance.\n\nKushner has been deceptive and dishonest, and there are many reasonable questions about whose interests he is serving in his efforts to influence US foreign policy. 5/'

b'Kushner had to update his SF-86 multiple times after failing to disclose connections with foreign officials and entities, including an attempt to set up a back-channel communication with the Kremlin. He has also been fined for repeated failure to file ethics disclosures. 4/'

b'The suggestion that Mr. Kushner has been adequately forthcoming during this process, or that he deserves a security clearance, is belied by his constant failure to honestly disclose his foreign contacts and business conflicts, and to properly complete his ethics filings. 3/'

b'The claim that Kushner\'s clearance was granted by \xe2\x80\x98career\xe2\x80\x99 personnel and not the White House contradicts the FBI, which told us "the granting or suspension of Mr. Kushner\xe2\x80\x99s clearance would be the responsibility of the client adjudication entity, in this case, the White House"\xf0\x9f\x91\x872/ https://t.co/wgGfyXcoif'

b'Today the White House and Jared Kushner\xe2\x80\x99s representatives are saying that the decision to grant Mr. Kushner\xe2\x80\x99s clearance was made by career personnel, and that this decision was the deserved outcome of an above-board process. \n\nBoth claims are false or misleading. 1/ https://t.co/btNV7RwhVd'

b'America needs to engage in the world, not withdraw & undermine our credibility. #IranDeal'
b'My full statement on the U.S. walking away from the #IranDeal https://t.co/GqU64uOc2X'
b'*us not use in that first tweet. Not only does our violation of the agreement damage the credibility of the United States, but walking away will also make us less safe.'
b'Congress should act immediately to express our disapproval for this reckless move. The path to global peace and prosperity is not through isolationism. #IranDeal'

b'These are just some of the many dangers we now risk with no deal in place. This decision will create an increasingly unstable world. This Administration has let down our allies and put our safety in extreme jeopardy. #IranDeal'

b'This move will also hurt the politically moderate movement in Iran, and empower the hardliners who are against working with the West. They will point to today as a reason never to trust the United States as a serious negotiator.  #IranDeal'

b'Without this agreement, we have no way to stop Russia from returning it to Iran who could use it to develop nuclear warheads, or Russia could use their possession of it to force us to make concessions in other foreign policy matters. #IranDeal'

b'For example, Russia has 25,000 lbs of low-enriched uranium they received from Iran as part of the JCPOA implementation. This ensured that Iran no longer had the resources to manufacture a nuclear weapon. #IranDeal'
b'If this deal falls apart, the consequences will be numerous. #IranDeal'

b'The Iran nuclear agreement has successfully blocked Iran from developing or obtaining nuclear weapons. Not only does our violation of the agreement damage the credibility of the United States, but walking away will also make use less safe. #IranDeal'

b'I am calling on my colleagues to come together to rewrite the Farm Bill & to find a better, balanced, & bipartisan approach that funds these essential agriculture and food programs.'

b'And these hardworking dairy farmers make a critical contribution to our economy here in CT & to our quality of life. I will continue to support bills & amendments that allow for balanced reforms to benefit CT farmers, consumers, & tax-payers w/o gutting vital anti-hunger efforts.'
b'As for our dairy farmers? Well, milk prices have dropped almost 40% in the last few years, and dairy farmers in New England are struggling to bring in the revenues they need to stay afloat.'
b'In fact, over 56,000 hardworking people in Connecticut are eligible for and participate in food assistance programs.'

b'Cutting more than $23 billion in nutrition assistance for families is simply wrong. SNAP is critical to preventing hunger and combating poverty in Connecticut and across the country, particularly for families with children and disabled veterans.'

b'I am disappointed that the Farm Bill we were presented with today\xe2\x80\x94despite provisions helpful to Connecticut\xe2\x80\x99s dairy farmers\xe2\x80\x94fails to protect the health and welfare of too many Americans. https://t.co/8X7zopjy3i'

b'Behind their joke is a serious sadness in how we treat our veterans. We ought to be doing right by them from the start. I\xe2\x80\x99m turning to my colleagues to support these bills that will transform the lives of veterans across our country when these bills come to the floor for a vote.'

b'Plus, we\xe2\x80\x99re taking additional steps to ensure that the veterans peer counseling program includes a sufficient number of peer counselors for women veterans and will focus on the mental health needs of female veterans (Peer-2-Peer Counseling Act).'

b'Thank you to members of the Joint Finance Committee for their partnership in this effort.'

b'This will require a long-term commitment. Today\xe2\x80\x99s vote is a major step toward that commitment and I look forward to working with the entire General Assembly through this session to ensure this additional surplus revenue is set aside.'

b'On our current pace and without action, our spending needs will outgrow our ability to pay for them.

That\xe2\x80\x99s why we\xe2\x80\x99ve been focused since taking office on:
\xe2\x80\x93addressing long-term challenges,
\xe2\x80\x93responsibly investing one-time revenue, and
\xe2\x80\x93making sure we don\xe2\x80\x99t spend beyond our means.'
b'This vote shows restraint, and a commitment to making responsible, long-term decisions about our finances.'

b'Delaware has a tradition of fiscal responsibility, and I want to thank members of the Joint Finance Committee for their vote today to appropriate only 97% of available revenue this year and conserve surplus revenue.'

b'Over the next two weeks, we will work with chairs of the Joint Finance Committee on a sustainable budget plan that makes important investments but conserves resources, and sets us up for the long term.'

b'If we fail to show restraint, we are setting ourselves up for difficult budget challenges next year or the year after that could require us to cut the very programs we\xe2\x80\x99re funding this year.'
b'The fact remains that our spending needs over the next several years will outgrow our ability to pay for them.'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve been focused since I took office on limiting spending growth, on directing one-time revenue into one-time investments, and on making sure we don\xe2\x80\x99t spend beyond our means. The new DEFAC estimates don\xe2\x80\x99t change our priorities.'

b'Finally, I\xe2\x80\x99ve introduced the Responsibility in Drug Advertising Act that places a three-year ban on direct-to-consumer advertising of newly approved prescription drugs.'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99ve also long supported the Affordable and Safe Prescription Drug Importation Act, which would allow individuals and pharmacies to buy drugs from other countries that are equally as safe as drugs sold here, but significantly more affordable.'
b'My bill would give the government the authority to regulate the price of prescription drugs and ensure no American\xe2\x80\x99s health is threatened by corporations who put profits above people.'
b'This week, I introduced the Prescription Drug and Medical Device Price Review Board Act, which prevents drug and medical device companies from gouging consumers with excessive prices.'

b'The President should have kept his promise and allowed Medicare to negotiate to lower drug prices. I\xe2\x80\x99m proud to be a cosponsor of the Medicare Prescription Drug Price Negotiation Act, which would help our seniors.'
b'President Trump\xe2\x80\x99s prescription drug price proposal fails to truly tackle the exorbitant costs that millions of hard-working individuals and families are struggling with.'

b'I am grateful to my colleagues who have called for due process before weighing judgment. I would urge them to continue to do so for any Member accused of wrongdoing. Basic fairness requires no less.'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99ll never allow that legacy \xe2\x80\x93 a legacy I owe to my father   John Conyers, Sr., who integrated labor unions, or my two amazing sons John III & Carl and my loving wife Monica, and the extraordinary people of Detroit \xe2\x80\x93 to be cast aside, or these causes to be in any way diminished.'
b'I am proud and fortunate to be part of a legacy of more than 50 years of fighting for civil rights and making our country more equitable and just.'

b'I cannot in good conscience allow these charges to undermine my colleagues in the Democratic Caucus, and my friends on both sides of the aisle in the Judiciary Committee and the House of Representatives.'
b'But I have come to believe that my presence as Ranking Member on the Committee would not serve these efforts while the Ethics Committee investigation is pending.'
b'These challenges could not be more pressing in the face of an Administration that cares little for the rule of law and a President whose actions and conduct cheapens our discourse every day.'

b'To be clear, I would like very much to remain as Ranking Member. There is still much work to be done on core concerns like securing civil rights, enacting meaningful criminal justice reform, and protecting access to the ballot box.'

b'I deny these allegations, many of which were raised by documents reportedly paid for by a partisan alt-right blogger. I very much look forward to vindicating myself and my family before the House Committee on Ethics.'

b'After careful consideration and in light of the attention drawn by recent allegations made against me, I have notified the Democratic Leader of my request to step aside as Ranking Member of the House Judiciary Committee during the investigation of these matters.'

b'In an era when faith in the system is waning, it is important the 115th Congress take steps to restore the confidence of our fellow citizens by fundamentally changing the status-quo of politics in Washington.\nRead more about the legislation here. \xe2\x86\x93\nhttps://t.co/3XT3tguaiv'

b'However, I believe it will help achieve a much-needed change in the current structure, one that\xe2\x80\x99s necessary to evoke more courage in policy makers to solve the big problems and focus on the interests of the people who sent us here to serve.'
b'Setting limits on the time politicians can serve in a particular office will not solve all the problems with Washington\xe2\x80\x99s broken culture.'
b'Following our bipartisan meeting with President Trump, and with his full support, we introduced this legislation to reflect both the intent of our Founders and the will of our citizens.'

b'Today, I introduced, along with my fellow freshmen colleagues @RepBrianFitz , @RepRoKhanna, @RepGallagher, @RepGonzalez, and Rep. Gianforte, a Constitutional amendment to limit the number of terms an individual may serve as a Member of Congress.'

b'This short-lived agreement between the previous administration and Iran\xe2\x80\x99s Supreme Leader should serve as a reminder that, in order to stand the test of time and out of respect for the Constitution, comprehensive arms treaties should be submitted to Congress for ratification.'

b'Now we must work to apply max. pressure on Iran until it agrees to irreversibly dismantle its illicit nuclear infrastructure, disclose the extent of its program to IAEA and allow for inspections, and stop its development of ballistic missiles and destabilizing regional activity.'

b'It offered permanent concessions for temporary restrictions, ignored the possible military dimensions of Iran\xe2\x80\x99s nuclear program, and undermined the Nonproliferation Treaty and six UN Security Council Resolutions.'
b'THREAD: The Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA) was a bad deal that left Iran as a nuclear threshold state with a stamp of international approval.'

b'The #taxcutsandjobsact repeals Obamacare\xe2\x80\x99s unpopular and ineffective individual mandate. You will no longer be forced to buy health insurance you don\xe2\x80\x99t want, don\xe2\x80\x99t need, or can\xe2\x80\x99t afford. You have the FREEDOM to buy the health care plan that\xe2\x80\x99s right for you.'
b'The #taxcutsandjobsact will simplify taxes, with nearly 9 out of 10 Americans filing on a much simpler and more straightforward form.'
b'The #taxcutsandjobsact DOUBLED the child tax credit to help families across the country. It also preserves the Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit and the Adoption tax credit.'
b'The #taxcutsandjobsact nearly DOUBLED the standard deduction, protecting more of your paycheck from taxes and simplifying the filing process.'
b'The #taxcutsandjobsact helps Americans keep more of their hard-earned money to save or spend as they see fit. An average family of four in Missouri-03 will see a tax savings of $2,055!'

b"Our hardworking law enforcement officers deserve better access to mental health services that will allow them to safely cope w/the stress & trauma they experience on the job. We focus on our police officers\xe2\x80\x99 physical fitness, but we need to ensure they're mentally healthy as well"

b'It directs the Department of Defense & the Department of Veterans Affairs to share best practices used by the military to help soldiers with PTSD & other mental health challenges with local law enforcement agencies to better address mental health challenges faced by officers'

b'We have a new tax code \xe2\x80\x93 now it\xe2\x80\x99s time for a new IRS. The House just passed bipartisan legislation to redesign and modernize the IRS so it puts taxpayers first. https://t.co/1HK4EtEPad https://t.co/GPKhCDjsWx'
b'I spoke on the House floor today about how we\xe2\x80\x99re taking bipartisan action to hold the IRS accountable and bring its technology into the 21st century: https://t.co/UmZS8e0KcY'
b'The House just passed bipartisan legislation to overhaul the IRS, including my bill to strengthen IRS accountability and modernize its technology. https://t.co/1HK4EtEPad https://t.co/avPVAiQvRZ'

b'Our metalworking and manufacturing industries keep our economy growing and Hoosier workers thriving. Great to see local manufacturers Steel Warehouse and Goshen Stamping with @OneVoiceforMfg to discuss job recruitment and workforce training. https://t.co/NHFAqZPcHn'
b'You can watch my full speech on the bipartisan 21st Century IRS Act here: https://t.co/UmZS8eilBy'
b'This legislation takes important steps to prevent future boondoggles, restore accountability, and modernize the IRS\xe2\x80\x99s outdated IT systems.'
b'That\xe2\x80\x99s why I introduced H.R. 5362, the IRS Information Technology Accountability Act, and I\xe2\x80\x99m thankful it was included in the 21st Century IRS Act.'
b'More money can\xe2\x80\x99t fix failed leadership or a broken culture at the IRS. Better guidelines, codified roles, and more intentional strategic planning can.'
b'Unforced errors are turning vital projects into boondoggles. The IRS isn\xe2\x80\x99t even asking the most basic questions before spending millions on software.'
b'Some of the IRS\xe2\x80\x99s IT systems date back to the Kennedy administration, but repeated mistakes big and small undermine our trust in the IRS to fix them.'
b'There\xe2\x80\x99s a trust gap between taxpayers and the IRS, and the IRS\xe2\x80\x99s information technology systems are a good example of why.'

b'The Committee has approved the report on the suballocation of the budget allocations for fiscal year 2019 (the 302(b)s) on a vote of 29-22.'
b'Chairman @USRepRodney: Approval of these suballocations today will allow the Committee to move forward and bring our bills to the House floor.'

b'Chairman @USRepRodney: We do not,  nor should we, have unlimited funds to spend. While there are many important programs across the federal government, tough decisions have to be made as to which provide the most benefit to the American people.'

b'Chairman @USRepRodney: They represent a balanced, responsible approach to government spending, ensuring domestic programs are also adequately funded, including infrastructure, efforts to combat opioid abuse, and school safety.'

b'Chairman @USRepRodney: First and foremost, these suballocations prioritize robust national security - rebuilding our Armed Forces, securing our homeland, and supporting our law enforcement agencies.'
b'The 302(b)s abide by the Bipartisan Budget Agreement of 2018, and continue funding for both Defense and domestic priorities as outlined by this bicameral deal.'
b'The Committee is now considering the 302(b) suballocations, which provide the topline funding level for each of the 12 Appropriations bills.'
b'The Committee has approved the FY19 Transportation, HUD Appropriations Bill on a vote of 34-17.'
b'The Committee has resumed consideration of the FY19 Transportation, HUD Appropriations bill.'
b'The Committee stands in recess due to House votes.'
b'The Committee has approved a Manager\xe2\x80\x99s Amendment making technical and noncontroversial changes to the FY19 Transportation, HUD funding bill on a voice vote.'
b'Chairman @USRepRodney: This legislation exercises the power of the purse prudently on behalf of the people we represent at home.'

b'Chairman @USRepRodney: The bill also supports @HUDgov and other critical community development programs. This includes funding for core housing programs that provide shelter for the nation\xe2\x80\x99s most vulnerable citizens'
b'The Administration has spent an inordinate amount of time thwarting these rail safety improvements, the completion of which might actually give some credibility to its infrastructure mantra.'

b'This includes Appropriations for additional funding for the NE Corridor, which is not just critical to New York and New Jersey but to the entire country. 20+ states rely on the East Coast rail system - not to mention hundreds of thousands of passengers who travel every day.'
b'These investments will be used to build critical infrastructure that is vital to our nation\xe2\x80\x99s economy and national security.'
b'Lastly, I\xe2\x80\x99m pleased to see important funding for critical transit projects nationwide, including commuter rail and bus transit.'

b'Funding is also provided for grants that will address critical rail projects nationwide and along the NE Corridor. These are needs that must be addressed promptly just to maintain safe and reliable current rail services for American families and businesses that ship freight.'

b'Chairman @USRepRodney: I\xe2\x80\x99m particularly pleased to see increased funding for critical rail and transit priorities across the country. This includes $1.9B for Amtrak, of which $650M is for the NE Corridor, one of the busiest systems in the world.'

b'Chairman @USRepRodney: Combined with the funding in last year\xe2\x80\x99s Omnibus, Congress has invested an additional $22.7B above FY17 in our transportation infrastructure to get our country and economy moving again.'

b'Chair @USRepRodney: Our nation\xe2\x80\x99s infrastructure has been neglected for far too long. Crumbling roads, aging bridges & rail lines &  clogged waterways are inhibiting economic growth, slowing this nation down. Hard-working Americans deserve safe, reliable, efficient transportation.'

b'Chairman @MarioDB: The bill makes important investments in housing infrastructure - including $3.3B for CDBG and $1.2B for the HOME program. These programs get money straight to state and local governments to support decision-making where it should happen: at the community level'
b'Chairman @MarioDB: Our commitment to help the most vulnerable among us with decent, affordable housing also helps get families back on their feet, and back to self-sufficiency.'

b'Chairman @MarioDB: Every state - and thousands of localities - will see the real impact of this funding as construction crews get to work on road and bridge repairs that are needed right now. This investment will help us strengthen our infrastructure and create jobs.'

b'Chairman @MarioDB: For @USDOT, the bill provides $28B in discretionary funding and $88B in total funding. This includes $4.25B in federal highway funding above the FAST Act - a 10% increase for highway and bridge projects nationwide, and the largest increase in this bill'

b'Chairman @MarioDB: We worked to ensure that there is no place for waste, fraud, and abuse of our constituents\xe2\x80\x99 hard-earned tax dollars. We also made sure we didn\xe2\x80\x99t grow the bureaucracy here in DC; this is why we prioritized programs that get money directly to states.'

b'Chairman @MarioDB: This bill builds on our accomplishments in the 2018 Omnibus and makes a second historic down payment to rebuild our nation\xe2\x80\x99s infrastructure. This bill is THE infrastructure bill Congress will consider this year.'

b'Chairman @MarioDB: This bill reflects our commitment to rebuilding our nation\xe2\x80\x99s infrastructure and to take care of the most vulnerable among us - especially the elderly, the disabled, and our veterans.'

b'Chairman @USRepRodney: Our Committee is using the power of the purse to support congressional priorities that will improve the lives of all Americans. https://t.co/FV8uc0KrqB'
b'Chairman @USRepRodney: The bill also includes key investments in programs that advance US competitiveness, keep our national on the forefront of scientific research, and foster innovations'

b'Chairman @USRepRodney: our bill provides funding that will support a favorable balance of trade for the US, promoting free and fair trade that will defend our economic prosperity, and enforcing our trade laws.'

b'Chairman @USRepRodney: Our global leadership role extends to our trade relationships, and I am worried that across-the-board tariffs on steel and aluminum products will have adverse effects on our relationships with key international partners and many of our allies.'
b'Chairman @USRepRodney: This legislation also makes America more prosperous. This includes funding for @CommerceGov programs that spur economic development and promote rational US trade priorities.'

b'Chairman @USRepRodney: Other investments that will make our country safer include funds to help reduce the sexual assault kit backlog, which is unacceptably high in cities and communities across the nation.'

b'ICYMI: my op-ed about rethinking Social Security numbers in the modern age https://t.co/7WqGfpcA26 via @RollCall'
b'He spoke about the timeliness of the issue and suggested that the first action we should take is to address the problem of using SSNs as authenticators.'
b'I also asked Mr. Grobman why he thinks NOW is the time to tackle the problem with Social Security numbers.'
b'She skirted the question about the whether the  practice was responsible, instead stating that if a caller was uncomfortable leaving their SSN, they didn\xe2\x80\x99t have to do so.'
b'I also asked Berryhill about Social Security employee voicemail practices, which tell callers to record their SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER with their name and phone number to get a return call.'

b'She said yes, the agency has taken a number of actions including: issuing clarification policies to frontline employees, conducting national calls with managers and directors, and employing regional experts to consult w/ frontline experts at field offices on difficult cases.'
b'I asked Acting Commissioner Berryhill if the agency is taking a close look at how it handles requests for a new SSN and what it\xe2\x80\x99s doing to make sure their policies are being followed.'

b'Identity theft is on the rise and we must take a hard look at the future of the Social Security number \xe2\x80\x93 both how it\xe2\x80\x99s used and if Social Security needs to do things differently.  We have a responsibility to do all we can to better protect Americans from identity theft.'
b'It shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t take a local news story or a call from a Congressional office for Social Security to do right by those looking for help.'
b'...What\xe2\x80\x99s worse is that it isn\xe2\x80\x99t Social Security\xe2\x80\x99s policy.  It was an extra hoop to jump through made up by a field office employee.'

b'I recently learned of a case in Arizona where the mother of a child whose SSN had been stolen was told that she needed to change her daughter\xe2\x80\x99s full name before her daughter could get a new one.  That\xe2\x80\x99s wrong\xe2\x80\xa6'
b'We will also hear from Social Security about what it takes get a new SSN when it has been stolen and why it is often harder to do than it should be.'
b'We need to break the link between identification and authentication.'
b'These numbers are valuable to identity thieves bc of how we use them: to 1) identify someone, and 2) to prove their identity.'
b'Make no mistake, it\xe2\x80\x99s still important to limit the unnecessary use of SSNs.  But, if we want to keep pace with identity thieves, we need to think beyond just keeping them secret.'

b'But after so many high-profile data breaches like Equifax, OPM, and Anthem, where hundreds of millions of SSNs were stolen, it is clear they aren\xe2\x80\x99t a secret anymore.  And it\xe2\x80\x99s time we stop pretending like they are.'

b'I have been dedicated to doing all I can to protect Americans from identity theft by protecting the privacy of SSNs.  Ex: thanks to a bipartisan effort I led, Medicare is now sending new cards w/o these numbers to seniors across the country.'
b'But given all the ways we use it TODAY, it\xe2\x80\x99s no wonder SSNs are a valuable target for identity thieves.'
b'The Social Security card and the SSN were created in 1936 so the Social Security Administration could track earnings and correctly determine benefits.'
b'WATCH LIVE: @WaysandMeansGOP Social Security hearing on the future of the Social Security number https://t.co/cN5VaiMAVq'

b'ICYMI: The IRS is giving taxpayers an extra day to file due to computer glitches https://t.co/TVl8JJlYmK via @CNNMoney'
b'I look forward to helping the Committee reform the IRS, hold this agency accountable, and put hardworking American taxpayers FIRST.'

b'Clearly, the IRS Oversight Board no longer serves a purpose and deserves to be eliminated.  Especially since other entities, like Congress and the Treasury of the Inspector General for Tax Administration, already provide oversight for the IRS.'

b'While the IRS Oversight Board was designed to operate like a corporate board for a business, it NEVER functioned as intended and did not provide proper oversight.  In fact, it has now COMPLETELY suspended operations.'
b'As a longtime advocate to stop waste and reduce the size of government, I\xe2\x80\x99m pleased that H.R. 5444 includes my proposal to eliminate the failed and defunct IRS Oversight Board.'

b'Welcome Home Col. Chuck Booze.  Your North Texas neighbors are grateful for your service and sacrifice in defense of Freedom.  You are a true hometown hero! GBU. https://t.co/ZB6KQhOn6b'

b'He mentioned a snippet of the DoD memo discussing national security, dismissing the CONCLUDING idea that steel or aluminum needed for national defense is not at risk.  FULL MEMO HERE: https://t.co/b7tFS7w3Ir https://t.co/G8h43mryr0'
b'I asked Secretary Ross why he and the Administration ignored the view of Secretary Mattis and proceeded with the tariffs...'

b'Secretary Mattis even wrote to Secretary Ross that the DoD doesn\xe2\x80\x99t believe \xe2\x80\x9cthe findings in the reports impact the ability of DoD programs to acquire the steel or aluminum necessary to meet national defense requirements.\xe2\x80\x9d'
b'As a combat veteran who fought in two wars, I am also deeply troubled that Section 232, which is intended to protect our national security, is being misused to advance a protectionist agenda.'
b'My home state of Texas leads all states when it comes to importing steel and aluminum products. So this is a big deal that could hurt Texas.'
b'I strongly OPPOSE the tariffs on steel and aluminum imports.  These tariffs pose a serious risk to our economy; could trigger a trade war; and may damage our relations with key allies.'
b'WATCH LIVE: @WaysandMeansGOP hearing with Commerce Secretary Ross https://t.co/r0OcQLyZd8'

b'He said seniors are very concerned about privacy & access to Medicare, & they are working w/ them as well as providers. They are also focused on ensuring the behind-the-scenes experience works and that the transition is easy.'
b'I also asked Mr. Kouzoukas how Medicare is getting the word out to seniors about the new Medicare cards.'

b'I asked the Principal Deputy Administrator of Centers for Medicare and Medicaid, Demetrios Kouzoukas, if Medicare is still on track to issue new cards next month & replace all cards by April 2019. He said yes.'
b'Ending the use of Social Security numbers on these cards is vitally important to protect our seniors & other Medicare beneficiaries from identity theft, as well as to prevent fraud & abuse.'

b'Back in 2015, then-President Obama signed legislation I championed w/ Rep. Doggett to end the use of Social Security Numbers on Medicare cards as part of the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act (MACRA).'
b'WATCH LIVE: WaysandMeansGOP Health Subcommittee hearing on the Implementation of MACRA\xe2\x80\x99s Physician Payment Policies https://t.co/r0OcQLyZd8'

b'I asked the Ambassador for the status of the proposed NAFTA \xe2\x80\x9csunset clause\xe2\x80\x9d, and what he\xe2\x80\x99s trying to accomplish with it. He said at the end of 5 yrs, the President will make a decision about whether the deal should continue. Congress would not have a say in the final decision.'
b'While I support updating NAFTA, I am concerned by the proposed sunset clause. I don\xe2\x80\x99t think that\xe2\x80\x99s good policy. Businesses need certainty.'
b'Over 1 million jobs in TX are supported by trade w/ Canada & Mexico. Nationwide, this trade supports nearly 14 MILLION American jobs.'
b'I also discussed NAFTA w/ the Ambassador.'
b'He said this process is ongoing & that the negotiations are down to the last few issues.  He said he\xe2\x80\x99s hopeful they can come to an agreement soon.'
b'I asked the Ambassador for an update on the South Korea negotiations & when it would wrap up.'
b'As the President looks to renegotiate this trade agreement, he should do so in a way that strengthens our alliance with South Korea.'
b'In 2011, I voted for the U.S.-South Korea Free Trade Agreement. Over 40,000 TX jobs are directly tied to this agreement, w/ hundreds of thousands across America.'
